course_title: Special Topics: Sustainable Ag in the Anct Med
class_notes:
"Sustainable Agriculture and Development in the Ancient Mediterranean." 
 
This class is designed to introduce students to the environment of the ancient Mediterranean as well as its interactions with, and its changing physical characteristics under the influence of the animals (human and nonhuman) who inhabited it. No prior knowledge of Mediterranean history or culture is required. In addition to learning how to read ancient texts for ecological evidence, you will also be exposed to the emerging bodies of research (archaeobotany/zoology, palynology, climatology, etc.) scholars use to supplement what we (think we) know from those texts.
course_description: Topic changes to meet current interest of students and faculty. Course may be repeated for credit as topic varies.
